isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 5000 9100 9200 9400 9900 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - GAUGES AND WARNING LIGHTS - 5000, 5000i, 9000, 9000i - OPERATION - AIR SUSPENSION RELEASE WARNING LIGHT

svcproc.title: AIR SUSPENSION RELEASE WARNING LIGHT
svcproc.para: The instrument panel mounted air suspension release switch (part of the dump valve assembly) closes when the dump valve is in the "Dump" position, exhausting the air from the air bags. With the switch closed, the warning light in the right gauge cluster is ON.

Ignition voltage (key ON) from 10A fuse F4-A, circuit 28C is applied through cluster connector (420) to the warning light. From cluster connector (420), warning light ground circuit 38 is attached to grounding switch (part of the dump valve). The grounding switch is grounded through circuits 38-G/11-GB at the right dash panel ground stud. With the switch in the "dump" position, the light is ON.
